result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).
  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total amount of $8,654.37 payable as follows:  $2,373.00 to Ericka T., Marquise T.'s mother; $1,500.00 to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance; $3,662.00 to Shaneal C., Jamar C.'s mother; and $1,119.37 to Jabar C.,  Jamar C.'s father.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATION:   To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two.  Credit for 147 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Cooperate with a mental health evaluation. Follow any recommended treatment.
No contact with the Canady and Tate families or with coactor Romeilo Brown.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Coperate and participate with any other conditions deemed appropriate by the probation department.
Cooperate and participate with AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision apply to both counts.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.  Credit for zero days.
------------------------------------------
Court finds defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program IF deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2/corrected to show revocation period as sentenced.
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Gerald Harper in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds.  One change made to the PSI's.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by both victims family members; Charlene M., Jeannette W., Omar W., Shaneal C., Victoria R., and Ericka T.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, consecutive to Count #2.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for 147 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, consecutive to Count #1.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMEDED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the Canady and Tate families.
* No contact with the co-actor, Romello Brown.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate witn any other conditions deemed appropriate by the Probation Department.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $8,654.37 payable as follows:  $2,373.00 to Ericka T. (Marquise T's mother), $1,500.00 to Milwaukee County Burial Assistance, $3,662.00 to Shaneal C. (Jamar C's mother), and $1,119.37 to Jabari C. (Jamar C's father).  The Court ordered that restitution is paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are revoked for a period of one year on each count.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Gerald Harper in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Defendant Gerald Harper in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Counts 3 & 4 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.

Court orders a presentence investigation.   Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.  

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Rick David Steinberg in court, defendant Gerald Harper not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State is awaiting the final toxicology report.  All other discovery has been provided to the defense.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information and waives reading.  Court advises the defendant on the charges and penalties.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to all counts.  Defense had received discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gerald Harper in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Defendant Gerald Harper in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Michael Hansen, O-MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State is awaiting testing and requesting an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 44. Arraignment is scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 8:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
